Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When updating a SpreadsheetDocument opened using a MemoryStream, the stream is not updated" (#1518) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Release 3.0.0-beta3 on NuGet" (#1521) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Please publish all beta versions on NuGet.
It will help us test out apps and libs against upcoming changes.
As well as publish beta versions of other libs built on top of Open-XML-SDK.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Publish all beta versions on NuGet

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Azure blob feeds do not work well for lib authors.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Open XML SDK v3: struct IdPartPair" (#1520) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
It would be nice to mention all v3-breaking changes in the release notes clearly.

**Screenshots**
Bug with the fix.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/assets/1197905/d00a99ed-b473-45c0-9781-635d8d883864)

**To Reproduce**
`IdPartPait` has been converted from class to struct in v3 (most likely for performance reasons).

This change silently broke code that worked fine before and checked the value with `null`.
After the upgrade, the code compile without errors, but some branches became unreachable and app/library no longer works as expected.

**Observed behavior**
No release notes yet ;)

**Expected behavior**
Mention such cases inside the Breaking Changes section in released notes.

**Additional context**
I believe that it will be helpful for apps and library authors who decide to migrate to v3.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Breaking change with Open XML SDK 3.0 in MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode.ProcessAllParts" (#1519) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: **Describe the bug** DocumentFormat.OpenXml `3.0.0-beta0002` removes custom attributes from elements on save, when `WordprocessingDocument` opened with `MarkupCompatibilityProcessSettings(MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode.ProcessAllParts, FileFormatVersions.Office2007)` Is it a bug or somewhere documented breaking change? **Screenshots** I've created a [repro code with a sample document](https://github.com/sergey-tihon/oxml-custom-attrs/blob/master/oxml3.tests/UnitTest.cs). This sample 1. Open a sample Word file using all 3 `MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode`s 2. Load `MainDocumentPart` as `XDocument` 3. Add custom `Unid` attribute (from fictional `pt14` namespace) to all elements 4. Add namespace to the list of `Ignorable` namespace 5. Save the document into a new file 6. Validate that the saved file contains added attributes. As you can see on the screenshot everything works as expected using `2.20.0` but does not work using `3.0.0-beta0002` with `MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode.ProcessAllParts` **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Clone repo https://github.com/sergey-tihon/oxml-custom-attrs/tree/master 2. Run unit test **Observed behavior** Document saved by `v2.20` with `MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode.ProcessAllParts ` Document saved by `v3.0.0-beta0002` with `MarkupCompatibilityProcessMode.ProcessAllParts ` **Expected behavior** The document should be saved as-is without removing attributes from Ignorable namespace. **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: macOS - .NET Target: .NET 7 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 3.0.0-beta0002 **Additional context** Found [during migrating](https://github.com/sergey-tihon/Clippit/pull/63) my copy of PowerTools to SDK v3
